items.sentence: Ladies and gentlemen, I would like you to listen to my opinion.
Several boys were playing guitars on the top deck of the ferry.
Tom is the only one here that doesn't know how to speak French.
Tom used to tell Mary stories about when he lived in Australia.
Tom wasn't sleeping on this bench. He was sleeping on that one.
It was a beautiful October day and we all had a wonderful time.
Who was that handsome man that I saw you talking to last night?
The man who fell off his bicycle seemed to be in a lot of pain.
I learned how to ride a motorbike when I was sixteen years old.
I can think of more interesting places to visit than Australia.
Tom brought Mary some flowers that he'd picked from his garden.
I don't think this old car will make it to the top of the hill.
It is easy to form a plan, but it is difficult to carry it out.
I'm afraid I won't be able to take part in the meeting tonight.
Of all the houses we've looked at, this one is by far the best.
I couldn't afford it. In other words, I was too poor to buy it.
As long as I know the money is safe, I will not worry about it.
Unless there is a miracle, we won't be able to make it on time.
If I could have a wish, I'd wish I could make up for lost time.
I wish Tom wouldn't keep telling everyone that I'm his brother.
